title: Ticket #618: VM Universe support for helper scripts to generate libvirt XML
description: This patch adds support for helper scripts to generate XML configurations for libvirt in the VM Universe. It includes an example condor_config for using such scripts, and a simple example script that reproduces the existing behavior of the VM universe.
remarks:
2009-Jul-15 20:39:32 by bkreuter:
Uploaded new patch based on Matt's comments.

2009-Aug-03 12:32:00 by jfrey:
General:
  • Why not use the code that already exists for calling out to a script to write the VM's control file (config param USE_SCRIPT_TO_CREATE_CONFIG)?
  • Why add a condor_config.vm_xml_helper file?
  • Config file parameter names should be in all-caps (XML_COMMAND, XML_COMMAND_DEBUG)
  • Need better names for XML_COMMAND and XML_COMMAND_DEBUG config params.

vmgahp.cpp: VMGahp:executeStart():

  • If XML_COMMAND is set, then a VirshType is always created. This parameter should be ignored if the VM type isn't virsh-based.

vmgahp_common.cpp: systemCommand():

  • Don't change execvp() to execv(). The VMware code needs it to find perl.
  • Do stdout and stderr need to be available separately? This introduces new deadlocking possibilities.
  • All callers of systemCommand() used to have stderr merged with stdout. Now they lose stderr. If a caller wants stderr, the behavior is different between unix and windows. On unix, it's separate from stdout. On windows, it's merged with stdout, but the caller must provide a dummy StringList for stderr that's always empty.

xen_type.cpp: VirshType::CreateVirshConfigFile():

  • Why is XML_COMMAND_DEBUG necessary? Can't the helper script write its debug information to its stdout or stderr? Will the file be appended to or overwritten each time the script is run?
  • Why is the script's stderr logged, but not its stdout?
  • You should call error_strings.rewind() before trying to loop over error_strings' entries.
  • You log the contents of error_strings twice in a row.
  • Was there a reason you used a socket in systemCommand() instead of a pair of pipes? With pipes, you wouldn't have the problem of being unable to close stdin and stdout separately.

2009-Aug-10 22:52:41 by bkreuter:
The exist code will not pass classad attributes that do not have the JobVM or VMPARAM prefix. I did not want to break compatibility with existing scripts by changing this behavior.

The condor_config.vm_xml_helper was created as part of an example of how to use this feature; it has two functional lines, and several lines of comments.

I changed the names of the two parameters; it is now LIBVIRT_XML_SCRIPT and LIBVIRT_XML_SCRIPT_DEBUG. The second parameter is needed to allow extra debugging information; this was the simplest way to signal to a script that extra debugging information should be provided. How this file is opened -- whether it is overwritten or appended -- is at the discretion of the script writer.

I updated systemCommand so that there is a final parameter, which allows callers to merge stderr and stdout. It does not appear that any current code in the vmgahp directory does so, but it is now possible nonetheless. The behavior on Windows and Unix will be the same now when the outputs are supposed to be merged.

The purpose of separating stdout and stderr was to allow the XML generator scripts to write the XML to their stdout; stderr can then be used for warnings instead of just errors. The stderr is not actually logged twice; it is logged once, but a second copy of the logging code was included for the case when the execution failed.

The rest of your comments should be corrected in this new patch.

2009-Aug-13 11:35:34 by jfrey:
Comments on the latest patch...

src/condor_examples/Imakefile:

  • Why is the make target for condor_limits_wrapper.sh removed? I have no idea what it does and it isn't referenced anywhere else in the code, but it doesn't appear to be related.

src/condor_examples/condor_config.generic:

  • Remove changed value of STARTER_DEBUG. I see the new config code (#123) lists D_NODATE as the new default value, but that setting doesn't exist. I'll talk to Pete about that.

src/condor_examples/condor_config.vm_xml_helper:

  • This file should be removed and the sample usage of LIBVIRT_XML_SCRIPT and LIBVIRT_XML_SCRIPT_DEBUG placed in condor_config.generic, but commented out. There's no reason to have a separate file, whose other contents have already diverged from condor_config.generic.

src/condor_examples/generic_xml.yacc, src/condor_examples/generic_xml.yy, src/condor_examples/mkqcow.sh:

  • What do these do? They don't appear to be used by anything else in the code.

vmgahp_common.cpp: systemCommand():

  • The parent process's handling of stdin_pipes and stdout_pipes is reversed.
  • childerr is never closed.
  • The patch still changes the default handling of stderr from being merged with stdout to being discarded. This will cause most errors messages to be lost, whereas currently they are logged.

xen_type.cpp: VirshType::CreateVirshConfigFile():

  • With systemCommand() using pipes, the blank line after the classad shouldn't be necessary, and the interface is a little cleaner without it.
  • When calling simple_helper.awk, you pass a filename on the command-line that the script writes the XML file into. After the script finishes, you then overwrite that file with the script's stdout, which it appears would be empty. One error print line in the script is missing a redirect.

  • Here's an alternative to LIBVIRT_XML_SCRIPT_DEBUG which I think is more flexible: The script writes the XML to it stdout, which the gahp then writes to the desired file. The command-line arguments to the script are set by a config knob LIBVIRT_XML_SCRIPT_ARGS. The filename for the XML file doesn't have to be passed to the script, since the gahp writes the file. Then, all arguments to the script are at the discretion of the script's writer, who can set them as desired via the new config knob.
